discussion.content:
Found it, link provided:

 CQD won't provide the root cause for every scenario
 CQD won't contain Phone System or Audio Conferencing streams
 CQD will call out areas for further investigation based on trends
Correct
This is correct. Checked and confirmed via Pluralsight training.

Quite difficult to pinpoint the statements related to CQD, but I think the given answers should be correct. "Call data gives you usage metrics, but it won't necessarily lead you to the root cause for poor call quality" and you also can analyze Teams media streams, not necessarily Phone Systems streams, which leaves "trends" as the only viable true statement.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company wants to use the Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard (CQD) to monitor and investigate calls.
You need to provide guidance on how to use the CQD.
Which action can you perform by using the CQD? To answer, drag the appropriate responses to the statements. Each response may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

HOTSPOT -
You are managing a Microsoft Teams environment.
Users report the following audio quality issues:
✑ Voices sound robotic or are garbled.
✑ Attendees cannot hear other participants well or at all.
You need to troubleshoot the issues.
What should you do? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Correct
Can anybody explain why the selection of "Poor Stream Rate" and "More then 3 percent" ? Why not "Audio Stream" ?

comments.content:
Take look in the link from the solution:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/quality-of-experience-review-guide

In the table of the point Define your target metrics there quality targets. The overall target for audio stream rate is 3% there.

I can not really tell you, why you have to take poo stream rate and not audio stream, but in the link they are almost just talking about the poor stream rate.
Because there in no "audio streams" in Teams, all media traffic flows are called just "streams" between clients or between a client and a server.
oops, please delete my answer, it's wrong

questions.question_text:
A company uses a Session Border Controller (SBC) with Teams Direct Routing.

A user reports that they cannot initiate outbound calls to the following number: +41 44 123 45 67.

The user can receive incoming calls. You observe that the user is assigned an OnlineVoiceRoutingPolicy that uses the following number pattern: ^\+41[0-9]{10})$.

You need to resolve the issue.

Which pattern should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Matching pattern
Answer is B. User has connectivity issues- Call analytics will not show any telemetry data because the call is not even connected

Selected Answer: A
"Call analytics shows detailed information about the devices, networks, and connectivity related to specific calls and meetings for each user in Teams"

Selected Answer: B
Call Analytics is used for figuring out why a user had poor call quality and meeting experience but the question states the user cant make og receive calls using the mobile connection and you have to be able to make or receive a call in order to determine whether it is poor or good.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/use-call-analytics-to-troubleshoot-poor-call-quality#introduction-to-call-analytics

Selected Answer: A
Going with A

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-call-analytics
boys/girls this set of questions does not say anything about Teams or Skype lol

Selected Answer: A
Call Analytics - You can use this tool in order to get detailed information related to specific calls and meetings your users have interacted with. This includes calls and meetings they are a participant in and has other information, such as the device they used, the network they were on, and if video and desktop sharing were used during the session

Question states: determine whether a voice call from the user was registered - you can see if a call has been made or not.

Selected Answer: A
Call Analytics contains telemetry and service diagnostic data meant to assist Microsoft support engineers in the Debug tab.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/use-call-analytics-to-troubleshoot-poor-call-quality

comments.content: Be aware, these question not always right. Please check and verify. Lets do this!

I think Call Analytics can also be used to review what happened with the originated call. Isn't that correct ?

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A user works from a remote location and has a LAN connection and a mobile internet connection. Each connection is provided by a different internet service provider.
The user can make and receive calls by using the LAN connection. The user cannot make or receive calls by using the mobile connection.
You need to determine the cause of the issue.
Solution: Call Analytics, determine whether a voice call from the user was registered and review relevant call statistics.
Does the solution meet the goal?

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A user works from a remote location and has a LAN connection and a mobile internet connection. Each connection is provided by a different internet service provider.
The user can make and receive calls by using the LAN connection. The user cannot make or receive calls by using the mobile connection.
You need to determine the cause of the issue.
Solution: Confirm whether the user can communicate with external users.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Answer incorrect. 
Not a solution, because we already know he cannot communicate at all using calls, so knowing whether he can call externally is part of the same problem and doesn´t help finding a solution.

Selected Answer: A
it is not a solution

Selected Answer: A
Incorrect.
The focus should be on the fact that the user can make and receive calls on one connection but not the other. Determining if the user is enable to communication with external users or not should not matter since the question states that the user can communicate with users using the LAN by making and receiving calls.

Selected Answer: A
The answer is incorrect. As Shredst0r said

Boys and girls, does it say anything about Teams?? lol
It could be just random phone related question, no?
If we ask a user while in LAN, user would say YES can communicate with external users. As soon as user leaves LAN he/she can not. Does it tell us the cause of the problem? LOL
I would say the answer is correct because the first thing you would do is establish basic connectivity. What works, what doesn't work?

It clearly didn't mention whethere the call made was a PSTN or VoIP call. The answer doesn't make any sense to me.

I would go for Option A.
It is part of a solution so B is correct
